claim: U.S. President Donald Trump or presidential candidate Joe Biden referred to the novel coronavirus pandemic as a time when “people are dying that have never died before.”
explanation: This claim is false. There is no record of either man saying this, and letters from Ernest Hemingway show the phrase can be traced to the famed U.S. author.

claim: President Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before.”
explanation: We searched a number of databases and found no evidence that Trump, on March 18, said, “People are dying who have never died before.”

claim: Trump said "people are dying who have never died before".
explanation: Searches in databases of the phrase never show up. Other fact checks confirm fabrication.

claim: Donald Trump said about coronavirus, “People are dying who have never died before.”
Donald Trump said, “People are dying who have never died before”
explanation: The quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

claim: Quotes Joe Biden as saying “people who have never died before are now dying from coronavirus.”
explanation: The quote was first misattributed to President Donald Trump. Joe Biden didn't say it either.

claim: A post says that Donald Trump has said, on March 17th, that people who never died before are dying now.
explanation: After analysing his speech on March 17th, we were not able to find this sentence anywhere. There’s no prove that Donald Trump has said that in that day.
